meanings.definition: More attractive or appealing in appearance.
meanings.sent1: The new dress she wore to the party was much dishier than her old one.
meanings.sent2: The sunset at the beach was even dishier than the sunrise.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's attempt to wear a tiny hat made it look even dishier.
meanings.sent4: The garden in full bloom was a dishier sight than a painting.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling diamond necklace made her outfit dishier than ever before.

meanings.sent1: This dessert is dishier than the one we had yesterday.
meanings.sent2: The movie star's outfit at the event was dishier than anyone else's.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to wear sunglasses made it look even dishier.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night were a dishier sight than during the day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful painting made the room look dishier and more vibrant.

meanings.definition: Having a greater level of attractiveness or appeal.
meanings.sent1: The new model of the car is dishier than the previous one.
meanings.sent2: The garden party was even dishier than the wedding reception.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt at a magic trick made the show even dishier.
meanings.sent4: The mountain view from the top was a dishier sight than from below.
meanings.sent5: The charming smile made him even dishier in her eyes.
